EmailTemplate.subject: News about the Honeywell Coon Rapids Transition- Product Cutover Reminder
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Dear Honeywell Customer,
As Honeywell advised in 2019, we have decided to optimize our operations and close our Coon Rapids, Minnesota facility by Q1 2021. As a reminder, the product lines affected by this transition include:
- Commercial Inertial Reference Units (IRU), Data Acquisition Units (DAU), Yaw Damper, and Flame Sensors are moving to the Clearwater, FL site. - Digital Analog Adaptor (DAA), Air Data Computer (ADC), Air Data Management (ADM), and Fuel Probes are moving to the Deer Valley, AZ site. - Control Sensor Products (CSP) have transitioned from our Golden Valley site to the Clearwater, FL site.
Action Required: This notice is to remind you of the upcoming changes required before September 28, 2020. To minimize issues or delays with the repair of your hardware, please follow these guidelines and actions. What to do now?
- Prepare for upcoming transition: Review the transition schedule and impacted parts list provided above, adjust your supply plan as needed, resolve outstanding holds to minimize transition delays, and take actions to ensure internal systems are updated to reflect the correct Honeywell location on the correlating transition dates
- Set/schedule updates to your internal ERP/MRP systems to support correct shipping destination per the table shown above
- Update Authorized Supplier List (ASL) as needed: If Clearwater is not already on your ASL, start working to add the new supplier to your approved supplier list. If you need to conduct an on-site audit, please email your Honeywell Representative.

Repair Order Processing Existing Repair Orders
- Honeywell will work to fulfill repair orders already in work at Coon Rapids. - Some repair orders may require a place of performance purchase order or contract modification. - If a modification is required, your Honeywell Customer Business Manager, Honeywell Contracts Manager, or Honeywell Support Representative will contact you to advise and coordinate the activity.
- Watch for PO or contract modification request from AeroRepairs@Honeywell.com <[[mailto:AeroRepairs@Honeywell.com]]>.
New Repair Orders
- To minimize delays to your repair, ensure that new repair orders are sent to the new location. - Part numbers received on or before September 27, 2020, will be accepted at Coon Rapids. - Honeywell will send part numbers that are in transit and received within 7 days of the ‘Coon Rapids Last Receipt Date’ to Clearwater for repair.
- A Purchase Order/contract modification may be required. - The Honeywell Customer Business Manager, Honeywell Contracts Manager, or Honeywell Support Representative will be in contact to advise and coordinate that activity.
- The MyAerospace Repair Site Capability list <[[https://aerospace2.honeywell.com/onlineordering/repair-capabilities/]]> (ROCAPS) will be updated to allow for real-time queries about where to send your repairs
Original Equipment and Spares
- At this time, there is no change to how original equipment (OE) and aftermarket spares orders are ordered
Aircraft-On-Ground (AOG) Support
- There is no change on how Honeywell will support AOG shipments for this hardware.
Our goal is to always provide you with the quality and service that you deserve. We will send out additional communications as we move closer to the next transition phase. If you have any questions about this transition, please reach out to your Honeywell point of contact.
Sincerely,
Honeywell Aerospace Customer & Product Support
